DataHubViewInfo.description: Information about a DataHub View. -- TODO: Understand whether an entity type filter is required.

created.description: Audit stamp capturing the time and actor who created the View.

lastModified.description: Audit stamp capturing the time and actor who last modified the View.

entityTypes.description: The Entity Types in the scope of the View.

filter.description: The filter criteria, which represents the view itself

Filter.description: The filter for finding a record or a collection of records

or.description: A list of disjunctive criterion for the filter. (or operation to combine filters)

criteria.description: Deprecated! A list of conjunctive criterion for the filter. If "or" field is provided, then this field is ignored.

ConjunctiveCriterion.description: A list of criterion and'd together.

and.description: A list of and criteria the filter applies to the query

Criterion.description: A criterion for matching a field with given value

field.description: The name of the field that the criterion refers to

value.description: The value of the intended field

values.description:
Values. one of which the intended field should match
Note, if values is set, the above "value" field will be ignored

condition.description: The condition for the criterion, e.g. EQUAL, START_WITH

negated.description: Whether the condition should be negated

Condition.description: The matching condition in a filter criterion

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.
